content: #16651 introduces fin_omega, a simple wrapper around omega that is useful for some linear arithmetic goals involving Fin. It's useful already, but somewhat hacky. I don't intend to promote this into built-in support in omega itself until we have a chance to do a full rewrite (and have a proper model for extensibility). In the meantime I think we can usefully iterate on this wrapper.
@Bhavik Mehta, wanna try it out for your circulant matrices?

Will give it a go, but I was inadvertently doing something like this anyway (converting everything into nat or int and hoping omega can finish it), but omega usually couldn't; so I'm not optimistic. Will try though!
Anything with a variable modulus (or denominator) is out of scope for omega.
(with some limited exceptions where you get lucky)
That said, most of the useful applications of fin_omega are relying on getting lucky... I guess this is why this is a Mathlib tactic rather than a lean tactic. :-)
